result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A. Pierce

defendant.name: Pierce, Joseph A.
defendant.address: 1175 Lake Geneva Blvd, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt:
2:14 PM (64-06) Defendant Joseph A. Pierce in court.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Joseph A. Pierce.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting Arraignment date.

Adj. 2:17PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 329226,
Payable Number: 269538,
Receipt Number: 22R 020121,
Amount: $20.00

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph A. Pierce in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephen Compton for defendant. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF871 & 21CF634

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH M.A.B (dob 1/7/2008) OR F.J.R (dob 7/25/2007), OR ANY JUVENILES OTHER THAN OWN CHILDREN OR INCIDENTAL CONTACT.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Joseph A Pierce in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Same conditions as previous bond, cash component added. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
